column4: Please paste your resolv.conf to the pastebin, and then tell us what you *expected* to see in it.
not "nameserver 10.0.0.2"
Sorry, I need more info. What is in the file now, and what you think should be in the file (and why)
i just dont want it changing to "nameserver 10.0.0.2" everytime i boot, so i have to change it to a working nameserver
nameserver 10.0.0.2 might be what the DHCP server is sending you, if it is acting as a forwarding nameserver. This is quite common.
yeah, but im not supposed to use dhcp at all. ...
However, look in /etc/dhcp3/dhclient.conf for DHCP config
cant i just tell it *not* to use dhcp? at all?
am i supposed to comment everything
Of course! System->Administration->Network
no, don't comment everything :-)
Does System->Administration->Network make sense to you?
yeah.. i just dont have gnome running atm.. ill swap :3
thanks
Don't swap - I'm sure there is a KDE equoivalent. Ask here!
im using openbox
what?
Do you have an interfces file, is openbox X, can you just run the gnome network manager?
uhh.. openbox is a window manager.
i can just swap, yes
Don't swap, just run the program. It's just an X program, it doesn't need Gnome (I think).
sudo network-admin, regardless of window manager.
